intro: Cnicus spicatus, commonly known as the thistleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs and have a spiny texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Cnicus spicatus is often found in disturbed areas and can be invasive in some regions.
